title: Textile, 1930s
medium:
Medium: cotton
Technique: hand screen printed on plain weave
inscribed: In pencil on back: 3/46; Small tag on front: 324 Hannah Friedman
dimensions:
H x W: 117.5 x 76.2 cm (46 1/4 x 30 in.)
Repeat H x W (minimum): 26.5 x 55 cm (10 7/16 x 21 5/8 in.)
creditline: Gift of the Estate of Ella Ostrowsky
description: Stright repeat of rectangular unit containing a circle with profile-view blossom at two sides on l axis. At corner of each unit is a flower with two leaves. the centers of the circles are filled with an eight-pointed star or one or two variations of a floral form. Painted in seven colors: gold, blue, grey, orange, green, brown, and rose.

participants.person_name: The Works Progress Administration, Federal Art Project

tombstone.epitaph:
Textile, 1930s.
1930s. Medium: cotton
Technique: hand screen printed on plain weave. Gift of the Estate of Ella Ostrowsky. 1976-98-17.
